DOC.brief_summary: Typically , CTIS Pregnancy Health Information Line Department Pediatrics , School Medicine University California educate pregnant woman call Information Line exposure medication might harmful develop baby already take place , therefore opportunity prevention exposure long exists . Frequently pregnancies unintended occur due lack effective contraceptive use . This study facilitate patient access UCSD specialize individualized contraceptive counseling woman reproductive age currently take medication might risky future pregnancy . This study also measure impact individualized contraceptive counsel change contraceptive behavior . Primary Hypothesis : EPIC ( EMR ) /physician-facilitated referral female patient reproductive age exist specialized counseling service UCSD improve utilization effective contraception among woman reproductive age prescribe medication might harmful develop fetus .
DOC.brief_title: Increasing Contraception Utilization Among Women Prescribed Teratogenic Medications
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective cohort study evaluate ) effectiveness referral system Family Medicine CTIS Pregnancy Health Information Line , b ) impact specialize counsel contraceptive behavior change among subset woman accept counsel enroll follow-up study . If woman reproductive age see Family Medicine clinician currently take newly prescribe one target medication , EMR electronic alert generate clinician . The alert say `` This patient may benefit referral CTIS Pregnancy Health Information Line counseling , '' click `` Accept '' `` Decline '' . If Family Medicine clinician click `` Decline '' reason must give decline . If clinician decide referral appropriate , he/she click `` Accept '' inform patient contact CTIS . The referral also include patient instruction . Within one week , CTIS counselor receive referral EPIC/EMR , contact patient . When patient contact CTIS Pregnancy Health Information specialist , brief patient interview conduct risk assessment counsel regard medication potential effect patient become pregnant , use standard care practice currently use caller CTIS Pregnancy Health Information Line . The patient also give information contraception , efficacy rate contraceptive method safety method base USMEC guidance patient 's medical condition . She instruct return Family Medicine clinician contraceptive service delivery . She also offer referral Reproductive Medicine UCSD counsel desired/necessary . The refer Family Medicine clinician inform outcome referral via EMR report . This report include USMEC contraceptive guidance patient 's medical condition . After counsel complete , patient ask interested participate research study . If patient consent participate study , still receive counseling EMR report still send refer provider contact later time regard contraceptive utilization . If woman decide interested participate research study , orally consent CTIS Pregnancy Health Information Line Research Assistant Department Pediatrics UCSD . If patient consent participation , contact one week , one month three month initial telephone interaction ask several question regard current contraceptive utilization change time last interview . Upon completion three-month follow-up , participant also ask complete satisfaction survey .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age participant : 1845 year old 2 . Gender participant : Female 3 . Ethnic Background : No limitation , include minority Spanish speaking participant 4 . Health Status : limitation 5 . Sexually active men 1 . Currently Pregnant 2 . Not sexually active men 3 . History hysterectomy 4 . Removal ovary
